summary: This is an email chain from August 2020 regarding the Office of Professional Responsibility's (OPR) draft report on the handling of the Jeffrey Epstein matter by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida in 2006-2008. The emails discuss the distribution and review of the draft report among U.S. Attorney's Office personnel.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central subject of the OPR draft report regarding the handling of his non-prosecution agreement (NPA) by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida.

events.title: Handling of Epstein matter by SD Florida
events.description: The period when the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida handled the Jeffrey Epstein case, which is the subject of the OPR draft report.

events.title: OPR submits draft report for review
events.description: The Office of Professional Responsibility sends its draft report on the Epstein NPA handling to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York for review and feedback.

locations: Southern District of New York, New York, New York
U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida
Office of Professional Responsibility, 930 Pennsylvania Avenue, NW, Room 3266, Washington, D.C. 20530
keyFacts: The Office of Professional Responsibility (OPR) completed a draft report investigating the handling of the Jeffrey Epstein matter by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida from 2006-2008.
The draft report was sent to the Acting United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York for review in August 2020.
The review request specifically asked for feedback on any content that might be sensitive to ongoing investigations.
The email chain shows internal coordination within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to review the OPR report.
